learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate high level interpersonal skills in written and oral communication, and in negotiation with internal and external stakeholders.
Critically analyse information and data to provide evidence-based recommendations for clients.
Demonstrate strategic planning and project management skills, including applied knowledge of the coordination, development, implementation and evaluation of projects or public health programs.
Apply time management skills to prioritise competing demands, adapt effectively to change, and complete tasks on time.
Demonstrate relationship skills by identifying, negotiating, and work effectively with clients, stakeholders and colleagues.
Understand and identify the role of various frameworks, guidelines and policies in addressing population health.
Critically reflect on personal skills, professional strengths and develop self-awareness for life-long learning.

assessments.task_description: This report contains key competencies. You are required to self-reflect upon each of these competencies at your interim checkpoints and rate your confidence for each competency. Your self-reflection should include a description of how successful you have been in working towards this competency during the semester. You should make every effort to provide specific examples wherever possible.

assessments.task_description: Students complete a final presentation summarising their work for the client across the semester and provide written reports for each deliverable. This is a 10 - 20 minute multimodal presentation during the workshop time where students share with the client/stakeholders their key findings and the accompanying written report.
